meanings.definition: To support or prop up with stakes.
meanings.sent1: She was staking the young tree to help it grow straight.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was staking the tomato plants in the garden.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was staking the flowers to prevent them from running away.
meanings.sent4: The team was staking their hopes on the success of the new project.
meanings.sent5: The image of staking the tent firmly in the ground stayed with her.

meanings.definition: To gamble or risk money on the outcome of an event.
meanings.sent1: He was staking his savings on the horse race.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys staking a small amount on friendly card games.
meanings.sent3: The friends were staking their lunch money on a game of dice.
meanings.sent4: The investor was staking everything on the success of the startup.
meanings.sent5: The idea of staking his entire fortune on a single bet scared him.

meanings.definition: To mark off or set boundaries with stakes.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor was staking the land for the new construction project.
meanings.sent2: They were staking the area for the upcoming festival.
meanings.sent3: The kids were staking their claim to the best spot in the park.
meanings.sent4: The team was staking out the boundaries of the playing field.
meanings.sent5: The image of staking the garden for the new fence lingered in her mind.
